name: Allen Iverson
team: Philadelphia 76ers, Denver Nuggets, Detroit Pistons, Memphis Grizzlies, Philadelphia 76ers
description: He won four scoring titles and became a touchstone for a generation of fans who loved his defiance and heart as much as his crossover.

name: Dirk Nowitzki
description: A 12-time All-NBA selection, he willed the Dallas Mavericks to their lone title, upsetting LeBron James and the Miami Heat in 2011.

name: Dwyane Wade
team: Miami Heat, Chicago Bulls, Cleveland Cavaliers
description: His first of three titles came in 2006, when Wade brought the Heat back from a 2-0 deficit and was named Finals MVP.

name: Jason Kidd
team: Dallas Mavericks, Phoenix Suns, New Jersey Nets, Dallas Mavericks, New York Knicks
description: The only player in NBA history to record more than 15,000 points, 10,000 assists and 7,000 rebounds.

name: Kevin Durant
description: Called “The Slim Reaper,” “The Durantula” or just “K.D.,” Durant has established himself as one of the top three players of his generation alongside teammate Stephen Curry and LeBron James.

name: Kevin Garnett
description: With 15 All-Star selections in 21 years, four straight rebounding titles from 2004-07 and easily the most lethal sneer in league history, K.G. was talent, ’tude and everything he was predicted to be when he entered the league in 1995.

name: Kobe Bryant
description: For 11 of his 20 seasons he was first-team All-NBA. The biggest knock on the Black Mamba is he was the second-best player on the Los Angeles Lakers for three of his five titles.

name: Lebron James
description: He is simply the greatest preps-to-pros player, edging out Kobe Bryant, Kevin Garnett and Moses Malone. He’s been to more NBA Finals than Michael Jordan (8 vs. 6) and had less of a roster in at least three of those Finals (bless Boobie Gibson’s heart in 2007).

name: Paul Pierce
team: Boston Celtics, Brooklyn Nets, Washington Wizards, Los Angeles Clippers
description: He actually played two more seasons in Boston (15) than Larry Bird did

name: Reggie Miller
description: Beyond the 3-point bomb he shot with aplomb, beyond his ability to curl around three screens to free his 6-foot-7, corn-silk-thin frame for a shot, Miller’s greatest trait was his ability to crawl beneath an opponent’s skin.

name: Ray Allen
team: Milwaukee Bucks, Seattle SuperSonics, Boston Celtics, Miami Heat
description: He broke Reggie Miller’s all-time 3-point record in Boston (with 2,973 for his career, Stephen Curry is still more than 1,000 behind), broke Kevin Garnett’s and Paul Pierce’s hearts when he left the Boston Celtics for Miami, and he devastated San Antonio with a 3-pointer to tie Game 6 of the 2013 Finals, the most clutch shot in Finals history.

name: Stephen Curry
description: He’s won a scoring title, two MVPs and two NBA championships — and he’s just 29.

name: Steve Nash
team: Phoenix Suns, Dallas Mavericks, Phoenix Suns, Los Angeles Lakers
description: A two-time MVP, he led the NBA in assists five times and for four seasons joined the exclusive 90-50-40 Club (90 percent from the free-throw line, 50 percent field goal accuracy, 40 percent on 3-pointers).

name: Tim Duncan
description: He is the greatest power forward in the history of the game. A five-time NBA champ, two-time MVP and three-time Finals MVP, he was the only player to be selected to both the All-NBA and All-Defensive teams in each of his first 13 seasons.
